com.jacobschneider.engine.math.geometry

Class Primitives.Sphere

  • Object
    • Primitives.Sphere
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Primitive
    Enclosing class:
    Primitives

    public static class Primitives.Sphere
extends Object
implements Primitive, Drawable
    A primitive implementation that represents a sphere in 3d space. This implementation accepts a rank parameter where rank*rank are the number of segments returned by getSegments()
    Author:
    Jacob

    • Method Detail

      • intersectSegment

        public Collision.CollisionInterface intersectSegment(Segment sBody)
        Description copied from interface: Primitive
        Returns the CollisionInterface that occurs between a segment and this primitive. If no collision exists returns null.
        Specified by:
        intersectSegment in interface Primitive
        Parameters:
        sBody - A segment object
        Returns:
        The Collision.CollisionInterface or null that represents the intersection of the segment and this primitive.

      • getSegments

        public List<Segment> getSegments()
        Description copied from interface: Primitive
        Generates a list of all segments that make up this primitive. If your primitive had hard edges, every outer edge must have a segment returned here. If your primitive has rounded edges you must return enough segments to define the boundary of your object to your satisfaction. Consider accepting a parameter to determine accuracy and making the number of edges dynamic.
        Specified by:
        getSegments in interface Primitive
        Returns:
        All the segments that make up this primitive.

      • getNormal

        public Vector3 getNormal()
        Always returns null because a sphere does not have a constant normal.
        Specified by:
        getNormal in interface Primitive
        Returns:
        The constant normal vector of this primitive or null
